name: BBCWorld
text:
At least 137 people are dead and about 5,000 have been injured

The explosion at a portside warehouse in Beirut sent devastating shockwaves across the Lebanese capital

Aerial images show the extent of damage to the city

[Thread]

https://t.co/qxDyCqlcPP

name: BBCWorld
text:
Grain silos took the brunt of the blast ‚Äì and absorbed some of the impact

‚ÄúWithout the grain silos in the way, we expect the damage in the area behind them would have been even worse‚Äù says Professor Genevieve Langdon, University of Sheffield

https://t.co/qxDyCqlcPP https://t.co/7MpaSlFv0E

name: BBCWorld
text:
Aid agencies estimate around 300,000 people have been left homeless by the explosion and there are fears of food and medicine shortages

The shopping centre, restaurants & souks in downtown Beirut, to the west of the blast, didn't escape damage

https://t.co/qxDyCqlcPP https://t.co/E9GboZYez1

name: BBCWorld
text:
Get the latest from Beirut, and see how the relief effort is under way in the city

https://t.co/qxDyCqlcPP https://t.co/g4cTRhApIZ

name: BBCWorld
text:
The Orient Queen cruise ship was docked in Beirut a few hundred metres from the warehouse when the explosion happened

Damage from the blast caused her to take on water and capsize

One crew member died and another is still missing

https://t.co/qxDyCqlcPP https://t.co/kMMg0RWajn

name: BBCWorld
text:
The blast ripped apart the city's portside warehouses 

Lebanon's maritime trade will now shift to the country's second biggest city, Tripoli, so that the country can start to receive medical aid, food, fuel and basic goods

https://t.co/qxDyCqlcPP https://t.co/nW6lp2VwKZ
